title: Mastering Claude 3.7 Sonnet & Claude Code: Agentic Workflows
summary: A technical deep dive into Anthropic's Claude 3.7 Sonnet release, focusing on its hybrid reasoning capabilities and the new Claude Code CLI agent. The workflow demonstrates how to leverage extended thinking budgets, integrate Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, and build custom agents that can execute bash commands, edit files, and generate massive outputs.

key_takeaways: Claude 3.7 Sonnet is a hybrid model combining standard generation with 'thinking' capabilities, allowing users to trade compute time for higher intelligence.
Claude Code is a CLI-based agent that uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to connect to external tools like 'fetch' or local environments.
Extended Thinking budgets (up to 64k tokens) significantly improve performance on math, logic, and coding tasks by allowing the model to plan and self-correct.
The new Extended Output capability supports up to 128k output tokens, enabling the generation of massive documents or codebases in a single pass.
Agentic workflows are shifting from simple prompts to orchestrating tools (Bash, File Edit, MCP) for autonomous problem solving.
